info.title: RMA_RestAPI_Design_1
info.description: Customer Requirements from Excel Document RMA_RestAPI_Design 1.xlsx

get.description: This operation list or find TACCase entities

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Comma-separated properties to be provided in response

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Requested index for start of items to be provided in response

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Requested number of items to be provided in response

parameters.name: createdFrom
parameters.description: Beginning date portion of a date range query to search for a matching set of items

parameters.name: createdTo
parameters.description: Ending date portion of a date range query to search for a matching set of items

parameters.name: createdSince
parameters.description: Retrieve the set of items created since this date

parameters.name: caseStatus
parameters.description: Used to retrieve a set of TAC Cases by status

parameters.name: includeNotes
parameters.description: Use this flag to include Case Notes

X-Result-Count.description: Actual number of items returned in the response body

X-Total-Count.description: Total number of items matching criteria

id.description: Unique identifier of the TAC Case

href.description: Hyperlink, a reference to the TAC Case entity

caseNumber.description: Same as ID, requested by customer

relatedRmaCount.description: Number of RMAs related to this TAC Case

relatedDispatchCount.description: Number of dispatches related to this TAC Case

problemDescription.description: A description of the problem assocated with this TAC Case

firstResponseDate.description: The date of first response from the TAC to this Case

customerTrackingNumber.description: A Reference to the customer's issue associated with this Case

contactEmail.description: The email of the customer contact related to this Case

productName.description: The name of the product associated with this TAC Case

productSerialNumber.description: The serial number of the product associcated with this TAC Case

productFirmwareVersion.description: The version number of the product associcated with this TAC Case

productSoftwareVersion.description: The version number of the product associcated with this TAC Case

caseSolutionDescription.description: A general summary of the solution to this Case

casePriority.description: The priorty assigned by TAC to this Case

caseOwner.description: The TAC name associated with the ownership of this Case

caseNoteCount.description: The number of notes associated with this Case

caseCreatedDate.description: The date this Case was created by Customer

caseClosedDate.description: The date this Case was closed by Customer or TAC

businessImpact.description: The impact to the customer's business associated with this Case

accountNumber.description: The customer's account number associated with this ticket

items.description: Extra information about a given TAC Case

id.description: Identifier of the note within its containing entity (may or may not be globally unique, depending on provider implementation)

schema.description: Used when an API throws an Error, typically with a HTTP error response-code (3xx, 4xx, 5xx)

code.description: Application relevant detail, defined in the API or a common list.

reason.description: Explanation of the reason for the error which can be shown to a client user.

message.description: More details and corrective actions related to the error which can be shown to a client user.

referenceError.description: URI of documentation describing the error.

post.description: This operation creates a tacCase entity.

schema.description:
A TAC Case is a record of an issue that is created, tracked, and managed by the TAC Case management system
Skipped properties: id,href

requestDate.description: The date on which the TAC Case create was requested

requestorOrganization.description: The Organization that is requesting the TAC Case

businessImpact.description: The impact to the customer's business associated with this Case

problemDescription.description: Description of the issue in this case

productName.description: The name of the product associated with this TAC Case

productSerialNumber.description: The serial number of the product associated with this TAC Case

productFirmwareVersion.description: The version number of the product associated with this TAC Case

productSoftwareVersion.description: The version number of the product associated with this TAC Case

outageStartTime.description: The date and time that the outage associated with this case was detected

outageRecoveryTime.description: The date and time that the outage associated with this case was recovered

customerTrackingNumber.description: A Reference to the customer's issue associated with this Case

schema.description: A TAC Case

id.description: Unique identifier of the TAC Case

href.description: Hyperlink, a reference to the TAC Case entity

caseNumber.description: Same as ID, requested by customer

relatedRmaCount.description: Number of RMAs related to this TAC Case

relatedDispatchCount.description: Number of dispatches related to this TAC Case

problemDescription.description: A description of the problem assocated with this TAC Case

firstResponseDate.description: The date of first response from the TAC to this Case

customerTrackingNumber.description: A Reference to the customer's issue associated with this Case

contactEmail.description: The email of the customer contact related to this Case

productSerialNumber.description: The serial number of the product associcated with this TAC Case

productFirmwareVersion.description: The version number of the product associcated with this TAC Case

productSoftwareVersion.description: The version number of the product associcated with this TAC Case

caseSolutionDescription.description: A general summary of the solution to this Case

casePriority.description: The priorty assigned by TAC to this Case

caseOwner.description: The TAC name associated with the ownership of this Case

caseNoteCount.description: The number of notes associated with this Case

caseCreatedDate.description: The date this Case was created by Customer

caseClosedDate.description: The date this Case was closed by Customer or TAC

businessImpact.description: The impact to the customer's business associated with this Case

accountNumber.description: The customer's account number associated with this ticket

items.description: Extra information about a given TAC Case

id.description: Identifier of the note within its containing entity (may or may not be globally unique, depending on provider implementation)

get.summary: Retrieves a TAC Case by ID
get.description: This operation retrieves a tacCase entity. Attribute selection is enabled for all first level attributes.

parameters.description: Identifier of the TAC Case

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Comma-separated properties to be provided in response

parameters.name: includeNotes
parameters.description: Use this flag to include Case Notes

get.summary: Get notes for a specific item
get.description: Retrieve a list of notes attached to a specific item by its item number.

parameters.name: caseNumber
parameters.description: The TAC Case number for which to retrieve notes.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Requested index for start of items to be provided in response

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Requested number of items to be provided in response

parameters.name: createdFrom
parameters.description: Beginning date portion of a date range query to search for a matching set of items

parameters.name: createdTo
parameters.description: Ending date portion of a date range query to search for a matching set of items

parameters.name: createdSince
parameters.description: Retrieve the set of items created since this date

200.description: A list of notes attached to the specified item.

items.description: Extra information about a given TAC Case

id.description: Identifier of the note within its containing entity (may or may not be globally unique, depending on provider implementation)

schema.description: Used when an API throws an Error, typically with a HTTP error response-code (3xx, 4xx, 5xx)

code.description: Application relevant detail, defined in the API or a common list.

reason.description: Explanation of the reason for the error which can be shown to a client user.

message.description: More details and corrective actions related to the error which can be shown to a client user.

referenceError.description: URI of documentation describing the error.

Fields.name: fields
Fields.description: Comma-separated properties to be provided in response

IncludeNotes.name: includeNotes
IncludeNotes.description: Use this flag to include Case Notes

Offset.name: offset
Offset.description: Requested index for start of items to be provided in response

Limit.name: limit
Limit.description: Requested number of items to be provided in response

CreatedFrom.name: createdFrom
CreatedFrom.description: Beginning date portion of a date range query to search for a matching set of items

CreatedTo.name: createdTo
CreatedTo.description: Ending date portion of a date range query to search for a matching set of items

CreatedSince.name: createdSince
CreatedSince.description: Retrieve the set of items created since this date

CaseStatus.name: caseStatus
CaseStatus.description: Used to retrieve a set of TAC Cases by status

CaseNumber.name: caseNumber
CaseNumber.description: The TAC Case number for which to retrieve notes.

requestDate.description: The date on which the TAC Case create was requested

requestorOrganization.description: The Organization that is requesting the TAC Case

businessImpact.description: The impact to the customer's business associated with this Case

problemDescription.description: Description of the issue in this case

productName.description: The name of the product associated with this TAC Case

productSerialNumber.description: The serial number of the product associated with this TAC Case

productFirmwareVersion.description: The version number of the product associated with this TAC Case

productSoftwareVersion.description: The version number of the product associated with this TAC Case

outageStartTime.description: The date and time that the outage associated with this case was detected

outageRecoveryTime.description: The date and time that the outage associated with this case was recovered

customerTrackingNumber.description: A Reference to the customer's issue associated with this Case

RmaCase_Create.description:
A TAC Case is a record of an issue that is created, tracked, and managed by the TAC Case management system
Skipped properties: id,href

requestDate.description: The date on which the TAC Case create was requested

requestorOrganization.description: The Organization that is requesting the TAC Case

businessImpact.description: The impact to the customer's business associated with this Case

problemDescription.description: Description of the issue in this case

productName.description: The name of the product associated with this TAC Case

productSerialNumber.description: The serial number of the product associated with this TAC Case

productFirmwareVersion.description: The version number of the product associated with this TAC Case

productSoftwareVersion.description: The version number of the product associated with this TAC Case

outageStartTime.description: The date and time that the outage associated with this case was detected

outageRecoveryTime.description: The date and time that the outage associated with this case was recovered

customerTrackingNumber.description: A Reference to the customer's issue associated with this Case

relatedTacCaseId.description: This assumes that an RMA case is a child case to an existing TAC Case

faultySerialNumber.description: This is the serial number of the faulty device requiring the RMA

id.description: Unique identifier of the TAC Case

href.description: Hyperlink, a reference to the TAC Case entity

caseNumber.description: Same as ID, requested by customer

relatedRmaCount.description: Number of RMAs related to this TAC Case

relatedDispatchCount.description: Number of dispatches related to this TAC Case

problemDescription.description: A description of the problem assocated with this TAC Case

firstResponseDate.description: The date of first response from the TAC to this Case

customerTrackingNumber.description: A Reference to the customer's issue associated with this Case

contactEmail.description: The email of the customer contact related to this Case

productName.description: The name of the product associated with this TAC Case

productSerialNumber.description: The serial number of the product associcated with this TAC Case

productFirmwareVersion.description: The version number of the product associcated with this TAC Case

productSoftwareVersion.description: The version number of the product associcated with this TAC Case

caseSolutionDescription.description: A general summary of the solution to this Case

casePriority.description: The priorty assigned by TAC to this Case

caseOwner.description: The TAC name associated with the ownership of this Case

caseNoteCount.description: The number of notes associated with this Case

caseCreatedDate.description: The date this Case was created by Customer

caseClosedDate.description: The date this Case was closed by Customer or TAC

businessImpact.description: The impact to the customer's business associated with this Case

accountNumber.description: The customer's account number associated with this ticket

items.description: Extra information about a given TAC Case

id.description: Identifier of the note within its containing entity (may or may not be globally unique, depending on provider implementation)

TroubleTicket_Update.description:
A trouble ticket is a record of an issue that is created, tracked, and managed by a trouble ticket management system
Skipped properties: id,href,creationDate,lastUpdate,statusChange,statusChangeDate

description.description: Description of the trouble or issue

expectedResolutionDate.description: The expected resolution date determined by the trouble ticket system

externalId.description: Additional identifier coming from an external system

name.description: Name of the trouble ticket, typically a short description provided by the user that create the ticket

priority.description: The priority of the trouble ticket and how quickly the issue should be resolved. Example: Critical, High, Medium, Low. The value is set by the ticket management system considering the severity, ticket type etc...

requestedResolutionDate.description: The resolution date requested by the user

resolutionDate.description: The date and time the trouble ticket was resolved

severity.description:
The severity of the issue. Indicate the implication of the issue on the expected functionality e.g. of a system, application, service etc.. 
Severity values can be for example : Critical, Major, Minor

statusChangeReason.description: The reason for changing the status

ticketType.description: represent a business type of the trouble ticket e.g. incident, complain, request

items.description: An attachment by value or by reference. For AttachmentRefOrValue, the attribute type,schemaLocation and referredType are related to the contained entity and not to AttchmentRefOrValue itself

id.description: Unique identifier for this particular attachment

attachmentType.description: Attachment type such as video, picture

content.description: The actual contents of the attachment object, if embedded, encoded as base64

description.description: A narrative text describing the content of the attachment

mimeType.description: Attachment mime type such as extension file for video, picture and document

url.description: Uniform Resource Locator, is a web page address (a subset of URI)

size.description: An amount in a given unit

amount.description: Numeric value in a given unit

validFor.description: A period of time, either as a deadline (endDateTime only) a startDateTime only, or both

endDateTime.description: End of the time period, using IETC-RFC-3339 format

startDateTime.description: Start of the time period, using IETC-RFC-3339 format. If you define a start, you must also define an end

attachment.description: File(s) attached to the trouble ticket. e.g. pictur of broken device, scaning of a bill or charge

channel.description: The channel to which the resource reference to. e.g. channel for selling product offerings, channel for opening a trouble ticket etc..

id.description: Unique identifier of a related entity.

@baseType.description: When sub-classing, this defines the super-class

@schemaLocation.description: A URI to a JSON-Schema file that defines additional attributes and relationships

@type.description: When sub-classing, this defines the sub-class entity name

@referredType.description: The actual type of the target instance when needed for disambiguation.

items.description: Extra information about a given TAC Case

id.description: Identifier of the note within its containing entity (may or may not be globally unique, depending on provider implementation)

note.description: The note(s) that are associated to the ticket.

items.description: A reference to an entity, where the type of the entity is not known in advance.

id.description: Unique identifier of a related entity.

@baseType.description: When sub-classing, this defines the super-class

@schemaLocation.description: A URI to a JSON-Schema file that defines additional attributes and relationships

@type.description: When sub-classing, this defines the sub-class entity name

@referredType.description: The actual type of the target instance when needed for disambiguation.

relatedEntity.description: An entity that is related to the ticket such as a bill, a product, etc. The entity against which the ticket is associated.

items.description: Related Entity reference. A related party defines party or party role linked to a specific entity.

id.description: Unique identifier of a related entity.

role.description: Role played by the related party

relatedParty.description: The related party(ies) that are associated to the ticket.

status.description: Possible values for the status of the trouble ticket

relationshipType.description: Type of the  Trouble Ticket relationship can be isChiled, dependent etc...

Error.description: Used when an API throws an Error, typically with a HTTP error response-code (3xx, 4xx, 5xx)

code.description: Application relevant detail, defined in the API or a common list.

reason.description: Explanation of the reason for the error which can be shown to a client user.

message.description: More details and corrective actions related to the error which can be shown to a client user.

referenceError.description: URI of documentation describing the error.
